title: Ben Davison ridicules accusation Tyson Fury takes out padding to hurt sparring partners
text:
Fury is not sparring at the moment due to an eye injury (Picture: Getty)

Ben Davison has vehemently denied Tyson Fury removes padding in his gloves to intentionally hurt his sparring partners.

Nicholas Asberry, a sparring partner of Fury’s, made the accusation in a video he claims proves the Gypsy King takes out the padding from his gloves.

‘This is Tyson’s s*** and these are the sparring gloves we’ve been sparring with,’ Asberry said in a video he posted to social media.

‘You can see there’s no f****** padding in here. All the padding is in the back of his f****** glove. Look at that s***.

What do you think mate? Tyson/or team taking padding out his gloves to hurt sparring partners?!? When they only do 1-2 maybe 3 rounds at a time in and out? For THERE benefit! Funny how tyson has great relationship with everybody he spars. Convenient timing too! https://t.co/lHpfZtDg9F — Ben Davison (@BenDavison_) October 20, 2019

‘I could touch the other side of my finger. There’s s*** falling out from the middle of the glove.’

Fury’s coach Davison ridiculed the allegation, responding to a fan’s question about Asberry’s accusation.

‘What do you think mate? Tyson/or team taking padding out his gloves to hurt sparring partners,’ he said.

‘When they only do 1-2 maybe 3 rounds at a time in and out? For their benefit.

Davison ridiculed the idea Fury takes padding out of his gloves (Picture: Getty)

‘Funny how tyson has great relationship with everybody he spars. Convenient timing too.’

Fury is set for his WWE debut at the end of the month and a super-fight with Deontay Wilder in February.

The British heavyweight will need to be in peak condition to beat Wilder and is currently recovering from two deep cuts he sustained in his last fight.
description: Ben Davison ridicules accusation Tyson Fury takes out padding to hurt sparring partners
